Calculated Reload.description: 当神射手装填他的弩时，还能够计算射击目标的最佳角度，使得他的下次弩打击的伤害骰从1d8增加至1d10，另外伤害骰还会获得+2环境加值，但前提是该次打击发生在他的下个回合结束之前。

Hurtful Critique.name: 损人恶评 Hurtful Critique
Hurtful Critique.description:
神射手对30尺内的一个目标的战斗风格作出诙谐但轻蔑的评论，对他的每一次失误表达同情，并就如何作出改进提供带有讽刺意味的建议。

目标必须成功通过@Check[type:will|dc:18]豁免，失败则会在攻击检定中承受-1环境减值（大失败为-2点），持续1分钟或者直至他对神射手作出成功的打击为止。

豁免大成功或者在失败之后对神射手作出打击的生物会免疫神射手的损人恶评，持续1小时。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.HKyMZobjOsd6WFuo]{效果: 损人恶评}

Arboreal Archive.name: 树精智库 Arboreal Archive
Arboreal Archive.publicNotes:
树精智库是离群索居的生物，常居住于偏远的荒野。这些古老的存在保存着关于他们广袤领土的记忆，留存着他们周围世界四季更替的心灵记录。他们对类人生物的了解各不相同，因为快速变化的政治形势让他们难以理解，但通过真菌网络、树精卫士和其他树木的低语，树精智库记录着他们在漫长岁月中所遭遇的每一场风暴、干旱或伐木威胁。它们的主要任务是观察并记录，而不是干涉时局，但他们愿意向那些展现出恭敬态度的人提供智慧。树精王会在冲突中向树精智库请求建议，商讨保护它们领地的最佳方案。

在一片特定地区存在一个以上的树精智库是很罕见的，当一位博学者意识到它们漫长的生命即将结束时，一群树精王会聚集在一起，将最聪明的一位推举为下一任树精智库。经过长达四个季节的讨论和协商后，该地区所有的树精都会齐聚一地，见证传承仪式。在仪式上，上一任博学者会将它们收集到的智慧移交给新任者，然后退休。

树精是长得如同树木一般的远古森林守卫者，它们培育新苗，维持生态系统的平衡，就好像广袤的荒野是它们的花园一样。树精平时深思熟虑，但是如果有什么威胁到它们的家园，它们会怒不可遏。

Abeyance Rift.name: 中断裂隙 Abeyance Rift
Abeyance Rift.description: 如果树精智库在完成知识传授仪式之前意外死亡，他们积累在根部和树枝中的知识在消散之前会产生强大的冲击波，对周围@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺}内的生物造成[[/r {8d10}[mental]]]{8d10心灵伤害}（@Check[type:will|dc:32|basic:true]豁免）；豁免失败的生物还会被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Axe Vulnerability.name: 斧类易伤 Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: 树精智库被斧类武器攻击命中时受到额外5点伤害。

Memory Maelstrom.name: 记忆旋涡 Memory Maelstrom
Memory Maelstrom.description:
树精智库尝试用漫长生命中所收集到的大量知识淹没敌人的脑海。这对@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40尺}内的每个敌人造成[[/r {5d6}[mental]]]{5d6心灵伤害}，目标还需尝试@Check[type:will|dc:32|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 生物依然保持镇定，不受伤害，并且在1分钟内对记忆旋涡临时免疫。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}并且受到一半伤害。

失败 生物受到全伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}[[/br 2d4 #Duration Confusion]]{2d4轮}，并且陷入震慑3。

Arboreal Reaper.name: 树精收割者 Arboreal Reaper
Arboreal Reaper.publicNotes:
有些森林让人有一种如田园牧歌一般的宁静感觉，而另一些则给人感觉出明显的敌意甚至邪恶——树精收割者最喜欢在后一种森林中出没。有时，这些林地会被那些从事邪恶技艺的团体选中，他们声称这种令人不安的环境有助于他们提升能力；树精收割者则认为只要森林的平衡不被破坏，就不会干涉这样的行为。

所有的树精都因其所处的环境不同而有着不同的外观，但树精收割者的外观总会显得有些格格不入，无论他们看守的是阴森的荒野还是热带雨林。树木收割者通常略有些扭曲，复盖着尖锐的突起，有时会在古老的废墟或其他古代建筑周围发芽，其身躯和结构会不断分离合并，最终它们会逐渐成熟且愈加灵活。

树精收割者关注的是森林生命循环中最为重要的腐烂阶段，在秋冬季节尤其活跃。它们的影响常常可以从朽木上爆发式增长的蘑菇或密集生长的食肉植物那诱人的叶子上体现出来。就像树精卫士一样，这些林地守护者感知威胁并做出反应的速度比那些深思熟虑的树精王或垂垂老矣的树精智库更快——至少以树木的标准来看确实如此。

树精是长得如同树木一般的远古森林守卫者，它们培育新苗，维持生态系统的平衡，就好像广袤的荒野是它们的花园一样。树精平时深思熟虑，但是如果有什么威胁到它们的家园，它们会怒不可遏。

Axe Vulnerability.name: 斧类易伤 Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: 树精收割者被斧类武器攻击命中时受到额外5点伤害。

Leech Moisture.name: 榨取水分 Leech Moisture
Leech Moisture.description:
树精收割者专注于一个50尺内的敌人，从目标身体中榨取水分。这会造成[[/r {10d6}[negative]]]{10d6负能量伤害}（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true]豁免）。

树精收割者在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Leech Moisture]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用榨取水分。

Azarketi Explorer.name: 阿扎克缇冒险者 Azarketi Explorer
Azarketi Explorer.publicNotes:
这位潇洒的阿扎克缇冒险者致力于探索内海沿岸的沉船和废墟。他四海为家，为保护自己的发现、生命和荣誉而战。

星陨之灾后，小部分阿兹兰特人在他们所厌恶的敌人——阿尔古苏（alghollthu）的影响下变异，从而在深海中幸存下来。阿扎克缇人通常被称为“鳃人”，有时也被称为“亚阿兹兰特人”，主要生活在阿卡迪亚海，内海和阿兹兰特遗址。他们继承了祖先那种傲慢的态度和紫罗兰色的眼睛，但同时他们身体上没有毛发，长着突出的鳃和蹼状的手足。大多人天生就能操控流体，可以制造水流，减少阻力乃至感知天气。这种力量究竟是来自阿兹兰特血脉的遗传还是阿尔古苏的影响目前还不清楚。

阿扎克缇人经受了几个世纪奴役和实验，直到被他们的阿尔古苏（alghollthu）主人抛弃。在之后的岁月里，阿扎克缇人建立了自己的聚落和社会，走遍了格拉里昂的水域，探索了破碎帝国的废墟和遍布世界海岸的无数文化。

阿扎克缇人以悠久的历史和传统为傲，族群封闭而排外。他们对造访水下聚落的外来者和搜刮阿兹兰特废墟的探险家很不友好。只有少数族裔会与沿海或岛屿上的聚落建交，保护他们免遭与水相关的危险或支持海上贸易。

Hydration.name: 补水 Hydration
Hydration.description: 阿扎克缇人必须定期将自己浸没在水中，以使适应水环境的皮肤恢复水分。在离开水体24小时后，他们会皮肤开裂，鳃部疼痛，强韧豁免受到-1状态减值。48小时后，他们挣扎着呼吸空气，开始窒息，直到回到水中。

Hydraulic Deflection.name: 偏折水盾 Hydraulic Deflection
Hydraulic Deflection.description: 阿扎克缇冒险者从周围的环境中吸取水分，创造一个盘旋的水盾来偏转来袭的攻击。直到他下回合开始前，AC获得+1环境加值。

Surface Skimmer.name: 浪里白条 Surface Skimmer
Surface Skimmer.description: 当阿扎克缇冒险者位于水下时，他们对水体外的生物的攻击具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{掩蔽 Cover}。

Azer.name: Azer
Azer.publicNotes:
Azers are an elemental people living on the Plane of Fire, often crudely described by mortals as brassy dwarves. They have stout, wide bodies with broad shoulders, shining metallic skin, and heads wreathed in flame.

Azer society is organized into traditional roles inherited along their familial lines, and an azer's role is indicated clearly by the metals they wear in their armored kilts. Their culture focuses on tradition and history, placing high value on obedience and conformity within one's community, and as a result it is slow to change. Many azers take pride in their ancestral roles and in fulfilling their inherited duties, providing needed services within their communities.

Long ago, traditional azer values of self-sufficiency and close community led them to build mighty fortresses across the Plane of Fire, where they isolated themselves from other planar denizens and even other azer communities. These values, sadly, also led to their downfall. Without any connections to or regular communication with other settlements, these fortresses were easily conquered by the efreet of the City of Brass, the dominant power on the Plane of Fire. Now most azer fortresses lie abandoned and ruined, with free holds so few and far between that most think them all lost.

Azers born within the efreeti Dominion of Flame belong to the populations that were conquered and assimilated into the empire ages ago. They live in perpetual service to the empire, disconnected from their history and culture, yet have formed their own close-knit society in the City of Brass under the fire genies' harsh rule.

A handful of azer communities have escaped efreeti conquest, most often by fleeing far from the genies' realms. Some of these azers now reside in hot, volcanic areas of the Darklands on the Material Plane, while others have fled to the remote depths within the Plane of Fire or made strange bargains with conniving allies or unknowable entities to keep themselves hidden. Prying outsiders nevertheless perpetually seek out these settlements, longing for legendary azer-crafted goods。

Heat of the Forge.name: Heat of the Forge
Heat of the Forge.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

An azer's skin radiates heat like forge fire. A creature that starts their turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued} while they remain in the area. Creatures immune to environmental heat effects or with any fire resistance are immune。

Burning Touch.name: Burning Touch
Burning Touch.description:
The azer's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 fire damage (included in strikes).

When the azer successfully performs a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} action, they also deal [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6火焰伤害} to their target。

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description: The azer shrouds their light hammer in flames and hurls it forward, dealing [[/r {2d6}[fire]]]{2d6火焰伤害} to each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:20] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true]豁免)。

Bauble Beast.name: Bauble Beast
Bauble Beast.publicNotes:
The reclusive and deceptive creatures called bauble beasts create false jewelry as a byproduct of their extremely bizarre magical digestive systems. Two natural skin conditions provide the raw materials for this process: scaly patches of thin layers of metal, and warts that resemble gemstones. By chewing loose these patches and swallowing them, a bauble beast magically constructs the jewelry in its guts. After passing the forgery, it polishes and reshapes the item to make it more convincing. The beast then sneaks into a settlement to place the jewelry somewhere it can be found. A creature who dons this false jewelry is compelled to fetch their real valuables and deliver them to the beast, which it happily collects. Some bauble beasts simply send the confused victim on their way, but other more evil bauble beasts slay them to avoid being found out.

This imitation jewelry fools laypeople, but it's infamous among merchants. Merchant training usually includes a brief course on detecting bauble beast jewelry's subtle but distinctive sweet odor.

Though largely solitary, bauble beasts occasionally socialize with others who share their limited interests, primarily merchants, jewelers, earth elementals, and other bauble beasts. Xorns have a particular fondness for bauble beasts-or at least their gems. Though these aren't as nourishing as real gems, xorns find the flavor decadent and eat them as a sort of junk food。

Forge Jewelry.name: Forge Jewelry
Forge Jewelry.description:
The jeweler beast creates imitation jewelry within its own digestive system. This takes about 4 hours.

Determining the jewelry is fake works like detecting a forgery, using either @Check[type:perception|dc:25] or @Check[type:crafting|dc:25] instead of Perception or Society, with a DC of 25.

The process of creating fake jewelry also places an enchantment inside the item. Anyone who dons the imitation jewelry is targeted with a @Check[type:will|dc:24|traits:incapacitation,linguistic,mental] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} spell with a duration of 1 hour on a failure or 24 hours on a critical failure. A creature that fails learns the location where the fake jewelry was created and is compelled to collect their valuable belongings and bring them to that location. Removing the imitation jewelry ends the spell immediately, but the wearer can't take it off voluntarily。

Philanthropic Bile.name: Philanthropic Bile
Philanthropic Bile.description:
Exposure to the bauble beast's magical stomach fluids enchants the mind.

A creature critically hit by the beast's jaws or bile Strike is subject to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.UirEIHILQgip87qv]{Charitable Urge} spell (@Check[type:will|dc:23|traits:magical,enchantment,incapacitation,mental|overrideTraits:true])。

Baykok.name: Baykok
Baykok.publicNotes: 猎生尸是一位勇士或猎人永无安宁的残余，因邪恶行为而被驱逐、被诅咒永远在远离家园的天空中翱翔，再也不能踏上地面。在这生物出没的荒野中的夜晚，能在几里外听到它绝望而孤独的哭泣。因嫉妒而催生的愤怒驱使它去猎杀落单的类人生物，尤其是勇士和猎人，因为他们让它想起了自己曾经拥有和挥霍的生活。猎生尸无形的箭上附着它足以冻结灵魂的孤独，它饱含妒忌的触碰能够偷走无助受害者的活力。

Banished from the Ground.name: 逐出地表 Banished from the Ground
Banished from the Ground.description: 猎生尸无法自愿接触地表或石质表面。如果被迫与之接触，只要它还保持接触，就获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}。

Arrow of Despair.name: 绝望之矢 Arrow of Despair
Arrow of Despair.description:
猎生尸在拉弓时会创造一只无形的骨箭，拥有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}值的生物在被射中后会孤独与绝望所折磨，并必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:26]豁免；如果打击大成功，则目标的豁免成果等级降低一级。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续1轮。

失败 生物的惊惧值+1（最高不超过4），并获得缓慢1直至惊惧结束。

大失败 如同失败，但生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}直至惊惧结束，他可以通过成功的@Check[type:will|dc:26]豁免来提早结束麻痹状态。

Devour Life.name: 吞噬生命 Devour Life
Devour Life.description:
需求 猎生尸邻接一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}的活着的类人生物。

效果 猎生尸触碰这个生物并吞噬他部分的生命能量。目标必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]豁免，否则将被猎生尸的耗竭诅咒感染。如果目标豁免失败且（在这次失败前）并没受耗竭诅咒的影响，猎生尸获得[[/r 20 #Temporary Hit Points]]{20临时生命值}，持续1小时。

Wasting Curse.name: 耗竭诅咒 Wasting Curse
Wasting Curse.description:
猎生尸从它的受害者那里夺取生机，徒留死气沉沉的恐惧。

如果目标对吞噬生命的豁免失败，他将获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

每次目标获得整晚的休息后，他必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]豁免，否则他的流失值将增加而非减少。当该生物从流失状态中恢复时，诅咒结束，但如果该生物因此能力达到流失5，他立刻死亡。

Betobeto-San.name: 咯嗒先生 Betobeto-San
Betobeto-San.publicNotes:
咯嗒先生漫游在物质位面的主路与小道上，寻找着不情愿的旅伴来满足魂魄对于恐惧的胃口。尽管这个阴影魂魄在黑暗和影子中是隐形的，但在光线下他们呈现为穿着一双木屐的朦胧无形的团状物。这双木屐由木头或骨头制成，让这个生物的步伐听起来是清脆的“咯嗒”声，这种声音也是他们名字的由来。一张宽阔，布满牙齿的嘴在这毫无特征的团状物中央微笑着，同时他们有着一双带爪的长胳膊。

咯嗒先生跟踪在夜间旅人的身后，一直尾随，直到那些生物用言语说出让咯嗒先生通过。这种行为通常不带有天然的恶意，更多是出于咯嗒先生对同伴和礼节的渴望；不幸地是，他们不知道这种行为会惊吓到他人。咯嗒先生不会攻击他跟随的那些人，但总是会以战斗收场，因为他们不受欢迎的行为会导致被跟踪者率先发动攻击。

Fearsense (Precise) 60 feet.name: 恐惧感知(精确感官)60尺
Fearsense (Precise) 60 feet.description: 咯嗒先生能够感知到所列范围内所有陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}的生物。

Ominous Footsteps.name: 噩兆步伐 Ominous Footsteps
Ominous Footsteps.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

咯嗒先生的步伐似乎越来越近，但声源却难以定位。在咯嗒先生60尺内开始回合的每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:29]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响且暂时免疫1分钟。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

大失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 4}。

Shadow Invisibility.name: 影匿 Shadow Invisibility
Shadow Invisibility.description: 咯嗒先生除非处于具有明亮光线的区域，否则是@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}的。

Shadow Step.name: 影步 Shadow Step
Shadow Step.description:
触发 明亮光源将要使咯嗒先生显形。

需求 咯嗒先生尚未处于明亮光线区域。

效果 咯嗒先生短暂地踏入阴影位面然后返回，出现在开始处30尺远的地方。

Stepping Decoy.name: 步履诱饵 Stepping Decoy
Stepping Decoy.description:
咯嗒先生快步移动。然后在@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15尺}内创造两个模仿他们噩兆步伐的幻象声音诱饵。

这些诱饵在咯嗒先生的主动回合独立行动，分别具有两个动作。他们只能潜行或行走，他们速度为35尺。在对抗@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek}或怀疑诱饵时，使用咯嗒先生的隐秘DC（通常为37）。

每个诱饵持续1分钟。如果咯嗒先生再次使用此能力，那么已存在的诱饵将会消失。

Bison.name: 野牛 Bison
Bison.publicNotes:
野牛是一种巨大的牛科动物，面颊较短，有两根长角；他们的体重可达2000磅，肩宽可达6尺。成群的野牛在格拉利昂的草原上奔踏轰鸣，震颤了大地。它们在塔尔多东部的呼啸平原（Whistling Plains）和卡斯马隆的国家卡拉支（Karazh）的广阔草原上非常常见；它们也在阿维斯坦凉爽的东北部有广泛分布，从河流诸国开始，横跨纽梅利亚，直至猛犸诸王国和萨科里斯西部。

野牛天生群居，在夏季的交配季节里会大量聚集，交配季过去之后公牛们会分开去草原上漫游。野牛能很好地适应残酷的草原冬季，因为他们厚重的皮毛在冬天会变得更厚，将它们完全包裹起来；在暴风雪面前，它们意志坚决地面对咆哮的寒风，蹲下来减少暴露在外的部分以求得生存。

野牛在泥土中打滚或在大石头上磨蹭的憨厚模样，很容易让人误认为它们天生没有攻击性。然而，这一假设导致了许多狩猎团体的复灭。它们身上大量的肉和厚实的毛皮让野牛成为了诱人的猎物，但在它的铁蹄轰鸣之下，野牛很快就能弄死那些对狂奔的牛群毫无经验的菜鸟猎人。这些狩猎队伍有时候会雇佣一些胆子够大的冒险家，他们可以运用他们的法术、装备和专业知识来确保狩猎成功。

虽然平原上的野牛最广为人知，数量也最多，但他们在茂密的北方森林和开阔的大草原上都有亲戚。这些野牛变种可能更加高大，但是速度和侵略性都远不及他们体型更小的平原亲戚。

Cold Adaptation.name: 寒冷适应 Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: 野牛能将受到的寒冷环境影响减少1阶。

Pointed Charge.name: 莽牛突击 Pointed Charge
Pointed Charge.description: 野牛径犄角低垂，直冲向它的敌人。它行走两次。如果野牛结束移动时在一个敌人的近战触及范围内，野牛对该敌人进行一次角抵打击。该次打击获得夺命D12特征。

Rolling Thunder.name: 雷霆奔踏 Rolling Thunder
Rolling Thunder.description:
野牛冲锋时尘土飞扬，大地震颤。

奔踏的野牛最多以两倍速度进行一次直线行走，对路径上所有体型不大于中型的生物造成[[/r {4d6+6}[bludgeoning]]]{4d6+6钝击伤害}（@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true]豁免）。

多个野牛可以共同参与雷霆奔踏，只需要花费能力所需的动作然后等待整个牛群准备完毕。在它们的下个回合开始前，当一只相邻的野牛开始雷霆奔踏时，能触发它的反应动作开始协同冲锋。所有协同冲锋的野牛必须采用平行的直线路径，所以覆盖的区域不会彼此交叉。协同冲锋会对区域内的生物造成额外[[/r {3d6}[bludgeoning]]]{3d6钝击伤害}，反射豁免失败的生物还会被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Blood Hag.name: Blood Hag
Blood Hag.publicNotes:
Blood hags, also known as soucouyants, infiltrate communities in the guise of young, innocent humanoids. This disguise is more than an illusion, for a blood hag wears the skin of a previous victim to hide her true appearance. During the day, her disguise is almost perfect, especially if the community knows nothing about the person the hag is pretending to be. But after sunset, the creature sheds her skin, hides it in a safe place, and stalks the night to drink the blood that sustains her.

Able to travel quickly in the form of a ball of fire and to slip through keyholes or the slightest crack in a door or window, blood hags feed on sleeping victims then return home before morning to don their stolen skin.

Foul creatures who appear as wizened old women, hags share little in common with the humanoids they terrorize. They are hateful entities whose greatest joy lies in the corruption and ultimate destruction of anything good and virtuous. Whatever power created the first hags is lost to time, but numerous hag varieties have arisen over the ages, each with their own powers and abilities to spread pain and suffering。

Firebolt.name: Firebolt
Firebolt.description: Note: Bestiary 3 does not specify a range for this attack. A range of 30 feet has been chosen, in line with the Storm Hag's Wind Blast.

Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet.name: Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet
Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet.description: A blood hag can sense the presence of blood and creatures with blood. She can tell the difference between spilled blood and the blood within a living creature。

Borrowed Skin.name: Borrowed Skin
Borrowed Skin.description:
A blood hag wears a covering of skin stolen from a humanoid creature she has killed, hiding her true form and granting her the effects of a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.c2bTWBNO1BYX4Zfg]{Misdirection}, with herself as the primary target and the creature whose skin she is wearing as the secondary target.

Spreading coarse salt inside the skin prevents the hag from putting it back on, forcing her to keep her fiery form until she kills another humanoid and spends 1 hour turning it into a new disguise。

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
A blood hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.YvXKGlHOt7mdW2jZ]{Death Ward}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.XS7Wyh5YC0NWeWyB]{Fiery Body}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Assume Fiery Form.name: Assume Fiery Form
Assume Fiery Form.description:
The blood hag removes her borrowed skin and transforms into a brilliant ball of fire.

She becomes amorphous, gains the fire trait and a fly Speed of 60 feet, becomes immune to fire, and emits light as a torch. She loses her melee Strikes and can't Drain Blood, but she deals [[/r {3d10}[fire]]]{3d10火焰伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免) to each creature that touches her, as well as to each creature that succeeds at a melee Strike against her with an unarmed attack or from an adjacent space.

If her skin is intact, she can return to her normal form by spending a single action that has the manipulate trait while adjacent to the skin.

The hag can instead Assume Fiery Form as a single action, bursting through her skin in a blast of flames. Doing so destroys her borrowed skin and deals [[/r {9d6}[fire]]]{9d6火焰伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免) in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20].

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.H99PJXU5cvJ4Oycm]{效果: Fiery Form}

Drain Blood.name: Drain Blood
Drain Blood.description:
需求 A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the blood hag's reach

效果 The hag sinks her fangs into the creature to drink its blood. This requires a successful @Check[type:athletics] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}. The hag regains [[/r {15}[healing]]]{15生命值}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour. Drinking blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any Hit Points to the hag but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a successful @Check[type:medicine|dc:20] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drained condition by 1 after 10 minutes。

Blood Painter.name: 血画师 Blood Painter
Blood Painter.publicNotes:
迷恋着自然世界，自身却又剥离其外，血画师是会用跟踪，杀死然后肢解来获取颜料和养分的八臂艺术家。血画师在生理上并不需要常规的食物，相反这种生物以收获的血液，以及使用血液描绘制作的食物而生。

在没有狩猎时，血画师会寻找美景，通过最上方两只手掌中的眼睛平静地欣赏，然后在画布上再现出来。非凡的艺术永远吸引着这些生物，杰出的舞者和画师偶尔可以通过创作新的作品来从这种异怪手中交换自己的性命。血画师会嫉妒地守护这些作品，他们财宝的大部分都由艺术品构成。血画师往往会定期策划对名作的偷窃。

Bloodsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 血液感知（模糊感官） 60尺
Bloodsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: 血画师可以在所列范围内以模糊感官察觉到暴露的血液，包括受到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{持续流血伤害}的生物。

Easily Fascinated.name: 易迷魂 Easily Fascinated
Easily Fascinated.description: 当面对具有失能特征的视觉幻术时，血画师不会因失能特征调整其成功度。

Dab.name: 涂血 Dab
Dab.description:
需求 血画师处于一个受到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{持续流血伤害}敌人的触及范围内。

效果 血画师触摸该生物，将血液涂抹在自己四只爪子之一上；血液在1分钟内保持新鲜。目标必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:28]豁免，否则将被血画师@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}。

Paint.name: 绘画 Paint
Paint.description:
需求 血画师使用涂血在一只爪子上涂抹了新鲜的血液。

效果 血画师消耗一只爪子上的血液来绘制出具有以下法术中一种效果的幻术：@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{幻象生物 Illusory Creature}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{幻象伪装 Illusory Disguise}、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.2oH5IufzdESuYxat]{幻象造物 Illusory Object}、或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{镜影术 Mirror Image}。

绘画动作获得所再现法术的特征，血画师可以对这些效果维持法术。这些效果使用的法术攻击修正为[[/r 1d20+20 #Spell Attack]]{+20}，DC为28，并被升阶至5环。

如果有两只以上的爪子涂抹上了新鲜的血液，血画师可以消耗所有血液来制造@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.TCk2MDwf5L5OYjFC]{炫彩披风 Cloak of Colors}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.RQjSQVZRG497cJhX]{震荡图纹 Vibrant Pattern}的效果。

由此能力制造的所有效果在对抗血液被用于绘画的生物时，在攻击骰，伤害骰，豁免骰，技能检定和AC上具有+2状态加值，且该生物在察觉检定和豁免上承受-2状态减值。

Bone Ship.name: 骸骨战舰 Bone Ship
Bone Ship.publicNotes:
几乎没有活物能在骸骨战舰经过后幸存——在它的尾流中只有死亡、毁灭和殷红如血的波涛碰撞、起泡。在一艘骸骨战舰成型时，死灵魔法自海底采捞出巨大的骨骸，然后满怀恶意地将它慢慢弯曲成型。鲸鱼的肋骨通常充当了船体的木材，而它们巨大的脊柱则扭曲成高耸的桅杆。肌肉和肌腱将船体捆到一起，在航行时收缩舒张以精确修正船的航向。

当一艘骸骨战舰发现另一艘船舶或找到其他机会来散布死亡时，散落在整艘船上的小号尸骸复活并组成船员和登船队。每位船员看上去都像一具类人骷髅，但它们可能是由多具尸骨拼合而成。为了作战，战舰还会创造出骨制的魔法大炮，通过魔法爆炸来发射骨片与残骸。环缀于船体上的黑色小宝石里困着溺亡船员的灵魂，因此骸骨战舰是受死去船员诅咒的遗赠。

当在海上发生大规模死亡的时候——通常是整艘船在远离海岸的地方沉没——濒死受害者的痛苦会催生出一艘骸骨战舰。这种事会在一位水手向黑暗之神提出最后的恳求，或一个神性存在找到机会将许多死去水手的灵魂束缚到一起，从而破坏性地展现祂的神力时发生。在骸骨战舰没有神力干预而产生的前提下，骸骨战舰能从被称为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.48agy7vl9fQW1LLA]{朽战尸 Draugr}的不死水手驾驶的船中缓慢而有机地成长。伴随着朽战尸的舰船在大海上肆虐并击沉其他船只，它们可以搜集更多的灵魂和骸骨，最终转变成一艘骸骨战舰。这类船舶有着拼合或不对称的外观，令它们不同于其他骸骨战舰。

一艘骸骨战舰近乎贪得无厌，对死亡、毁灭、和增加它的灵魂收藏有着永无止境的渴望。这些欲望源于一个潜在的原因，它要么是由创造者植在船内，要么是由组成它的灵魂们散落的遗愿累积而成。例如，一位神性存在可能会派一艘骸骨战舰执行特殊任务：传递信息或者除掉一个顽固的敌手或麻烦。尽管骸骨战舰通常在海浪上航行，但它们不需要呼吸，可以按照其创造者的要求执行水下任务。

骸骨战舰在水手间享有传奇级的声誉。这类亡灵可以凭空出现来造成破坏，如果一场海难后一船的尸体都不见了，这场灾难就可能被怪罪到一艘骸骨战舰头上。大海能以多种方式在瞬间带来死亡，但灵魂被永世奴役的命运远比死亡更可怕。

7xqB2gVMxUHI1QMC.name: 骷髅船员 Skeleton Crew
7xqB2gVMxUHI1QMC.description:
骸骨战舰并非由单一的心智，而是死去水手灵魂累积成的集体意识所驱使。

这艘船免疫只针对特定数量的心灵效果。它仍然会受到影响一个区域内全部生物的心灵效果的影响。

任何试图通过心灵感应与船沟通或解读它的思想的生物只会听到船员们垂死的尖叫和喘息，并成为一个9环@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.8kJbiBEjMWG4VUjs]{心灵扭曲 Warp Mind}法术的目标（@Check[type:will|dc:41|traits:magical,enchantment,emotion,incapacitation,mental|overrideTraits:true]）。

这艘船从它自身的骨架中唤起骸骨船员，为它们配备生锈的旧弯刀或其他武器，这样它们就可以攻击任何靠近船的人。这些实体的外表与被束缚的灵魂生前的样貌相仿，但它们不是真正的独立个体；任何以它们为目标的效果实际上是以它们所属的骸骨战舰为目标。

数以百计的黑色灵魂宝石装点着船的外壳，每一颗都囚困着一个灵魂。这些宝石能容纳等级为16或更低的生物灵魂，且它们没有价值。如果船被摧毁了，所有的宝石都会破碎，释放内含的灵魂。

Trawl for Bones.name: 拖网寻骨 Trawl for Bones
Trawl for Bones.description: 骸骨战舰花费一天从海洋中捡拾骨头，将它的生命值回满。

Blood Wake.name: 血潮涌动 Blood Wake
Blood Wake.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

骸骨战舰四周涌动的海水被渗出的鲜血染成了红色。一个进入了灵光内的海水的活物会看到自己淹溺在血水中的幻象，他必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:37]豁免。在进行这次豁免后，此生物临时免疫1小时。

豁免失败的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}（大失败获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 4}）和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}，并在游泳的运动鉴定中获得-4状态减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.oORIapm28xioxPDp]{效果: 血潮涌动}

Cannonade.name: 连环炮击 Cannonade
Cannonade.description: 骸骨战舰进行四次白骨舰炮打击，每个打击瞄准不同的目标。

Chain Shot.name: 锁链射击 Chain Shot
Chain Shot.description:
骸骨战舰进行一次特殊的打击，射出一条由白骨制成的锁链。被这个打击命中的生物被锁链@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}（@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape}DC41）。

骸骨战舰可以使用交互动作将一个被擒抱的生物拉近，每个动作拉近50尺；当船移动时，它拖着被擒抱的生物一起走。

Crew's Call.name: 船员的呼唤 Crew's Call
Crew's Call.description:
船员们齐声发出痛苦的哭嚎。这相当于一个范围@Template[type:emanation|distance:100]的9环@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.FEsuyf203wTNE2et]{女妖之嚎 Wail of the Banshee}法术（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|traits:magical,necromancy,auditory,death,negative]）。此外，任何距船5尺范围内的生物被船员@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}。

这艘船在[[/br 1d4+1 #Recharge Crew's Call]]{1d4+1轮}内无法再次使用船员的呼唤。

Keelhaul.name: 龙骨拖拽 Keelhaul
Keelhaul.description:
如同践踏(超大型或更小体型, 船体, @Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]), 但骸骨战舰会以双倍的速度游泳而非行走，每个豁免失败的生物还会被拖到船底。

在船的移动结束时，GM将每个豁免失败的生物放置到一个与船邻接的水下区域。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Pressgang Soul.name: 征募亡魂 Pressgang Soul
Pressgang Soul.description:
骸骨战舰释放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{缚魂术 Bind Soul}。所选的目标必须因骸骨战舰的袭击或溺水而死。这个生物的灵魂成为幽灵船员的一部分。

一颗新的灵魂宝石从船上长出，骸骨战舰在1分钟内获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}状态。它只能用这个额外动作来打击或游泳。

Bore Worm Swarm.name: Bore Worm Swarm
Bore Worm Swarm.publicNotes:
A single finger-length bore worm is unpleasant but mostly innocuous. Ten thousand bore worms, on the other hand, pose a formidable threat to even seasoned adventurers. The countless worms form a roiling, rancid mass of acid and pain, capable of delivering a hideous death to any person or beast unable to escape them. Unfortunately for any creature other than a bore worm, most encounters involve swarms.

These Darklands vermin produce corrosive, noxious slime and deliver agonizing bites, whether as a revolting, wriggling swarm of finger-length worms or a single massive, lurching beast. Among Darklands communities, most inhabitants regard bore worms much in the same way surface cultures speak of maggots or cockroaches-with general disdain and revulsion. Children consider catching a single bore worm and using it to torment others a rite of passage, albeit a dangerous one.

The humble bore worm is a small and simple creature, both biologically and magically. These qualities allow it to adapt rapidly to different environments, some of them quite extreme, and also makes it susceptible to magical radiation and experimentation. Many a Darklands apprentice takes their first steps in the school of transmutation by practicing on these worms, while variations-both natural and cultivated-are scattered about beneath Golarion's surface。

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {3d6}[acid]]]{3d6 acid伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]豁免).

Creatures that fail this save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} from the swarm's painful bites。

Brainchild.name: Brainchild
Brainchild.publicNotes: A rumor can become so vivid and so persistent that it comes to life, creating a brainchild-a living illusion that hatches from an intense belief in a remorseless and implacable killer. Often, these rumors swirl around the victims of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell. A brainchild's capabilities grow when they pursue a believer but deflate against skeptics, making them only as bad as one thinks they are. A simple drive to stalk, terrify, and kill propels a brainchild, but the creature might also exhibit other behaviors ascribed to them through gossip。

Universal Language.name: Universal Language
Universal Language.description: Anything spoken by the brainchild is perceived by the listener in its native language。

Urban Legend.name: Urban Legend
Urban Legend.description:
A brainchild is sustained only by the reputation that precedes them. Mindless creatures are immune to a brainchild and can't perceive them.

The brainchild's size, features, and items, as well as the appearance of their attacks, match what the foes perceiving them expect. If foes expect to see different things, the brainchild chooses which to manifest. If any creature that can perceive the brainchild believes the brainchild has one of the abilities below, the brainchild has that ability.

A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} (against the brainchild's Deception DC) to attempt to disbelieve an individual ability. If at any point no creature perceiving the brainchild believes in the ability, the brainchild loses that ability immediately. If foes expect different particulars, such as one believing the brainchild is immune to fire and another believing they're immune to divinations, the brainchild chooses one to have.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} (imprecise) 100 feet
  • Immunity to one damage type, magic school, or condition
  • Weakness 10 to one damage type other than mental
  • Resistance 10 to physical damage, with an exception for either cold iron or silver
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence} (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 100 feet, DC 28
  • [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} Extra Damage on Strikes, of a type one foe believes in
  • Additional Spells @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} at 6th level

Persistence of Memory.name: Persistence of Memory
Persistence of Memory.description: When a brainchild is destroyed, it returns if anyone still fully believes it exists, re-forming within 100 feet of any believer after [[/br 2d4 #Persistance of Memory]]{2d4 days}。

Brimorak.name: 爆燃魔 Brimorak
Brimorak.publicNotes:
这些山羊头恶魔有发光的红眼睛和燃烧的蹄子，但高度只有3尺。浑身冒火的爆燃魔从纵火犯的灵魂中诞生，并且继续他们在生活中追求的工作，因为它们接触到的一切都会迅速燃烧。

一般而言即使对恶魔来说，爆燃魔脾气也算是暴躁的，但它们的怨恨在面对不断增长的火焰时会变得开心。那些与这些恶魔遭遇过的幸存者报告说，他们清楚地记得爆燃魔的笑声，就像火焰的热量或令人窒息的烟味一样清晰。

被罪恶扭曲和腐化的凡人灵魂有时会在来世转变为恶魔。这些强大而具有破坏性的恶魔试图散播他们特定的罪孽来扭曲更多的灵魂，从而增加它们的数量并继续循环。

Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals [[/r {3d6}[mental]]]{3d6心灵伤害}. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals [[/r {5d6}[mental]]]{5d6心灵伤害} per round。

Smoke Vision.name: 烟视 Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} condition from smoke。

Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals [[/r {2d4}[fire]]]{2d4火焰伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]豁免)。

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[type:line|distance:20] that deals [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6火焰伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true]豁免).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first。

VRhuQIGcrHKCOyL4.name: Flaming Weapon
VRhuQIGcrHKCOyL4.description:
A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra 1d6 fire damage with each hit.

If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above)。

Fume.name: Fume
Fume.description:
The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] that remains in place for [[/br 1d4 #Duration Fume]]{1d4轮}.

All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2} on a critical failure)。

Buso Farmer.name: Buso Farmer
Buso Farmer.publicNotes:
Busos are tree-dwelling folk with a simmering desire to consume the flesh of others. They to heavily supplement their food with leaves and root crops, possess significant knowledge of agriculture, and boast innate powers over plants and their growth. In regards to meat, however, busos reject the flesh of beasts; they instead consume other humanoids. Not only do they find the taste of other creatures repulsive, but their bodies reject non-humanoid meat since it provides them no nutritional value and consuming it leaves them sickened and weak.

Busos' unusual dietary needs mean they're almost always at odds with neighboring cultures. They typically maintain decent relations only with goblins, who are as a people less prone to judging others based on diet. Other communities fear busos-with some justification-though aside from the occasional forays to harvest someone for their next meal, busos tend to keep to themselves. In some desperate locations, communities faced with famine or other natural disasters might even seek out busos' aid, offering victims in exchange for knowledge or magical assistance that might save their communities from slow and terrible deaths through starvation.

A buso's single eye sometimes leads to them being compared to cyclopes. However, both types of creatures deny any common ancestry, and they first appeared independently in entirely different parts of the world with substantially divergent abilities. For their part, busos believe that their ancestors' deeds gave rise to their single eyes. When faced with a famine that threatened their existence, these ancestors each cut out one of their eyes as an offering to the malevolent spirits of the forest, imploring for their salvation. Busos say that these spirits, whom they call the busaw, gave them their knowledge of agriculture, power over plants, and craving for sentient flesh. Henceforth, they revered the busaw as gods and called themselves buso: those who worship the busaw。

Resize Plant.name: Resize Plant
Resize Plant.description:
频率 twice per day.

需求 The buso touches a Small, Medium, or Large plant.

效果 The plant grows or shrinks by one size, remaining that size for the next 5 minutes. If used on a plant creature, this effect has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} (buso's choice). Unwilling plant creatures can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] saving throw to resist this effect。

Cactus Leshy.name: Cactus Leshy
Cactus Leshy.publicNotes:
These little plants are known for their nettlesome attitude. Their personalities mirror the spines that sprout from all over their bodies, making them cantankerous and slightly prickly, though they are unswervingly loyal to those who earn their trust. At home in dry and arid landscapes, cactus leshys store water inside their bodies in order to survive these harsh conditions.

Cactus leshys come in all different shapes and colors: tall and thin, with beautiful, vibrantly colored blooms on their heads; squat and rotund, with rows and rows of orderly spines; or seemingly haphazard, with flat segments stacked end to end as if they were balancing on one another.

Often found assisting practitioners of nature magic, leshys are sentient flora that protect the natural world and sacred spaces within forests, fields, and other environments. Leshys are nature spirits inhabiting bodies constructed of plant matter fused together by a primal ritual。

Little Oasis.name: Little Oasis
Little Oasis.description: If a cactus leshy is willing, a creature can harvest enough water from the leshy's inner cavity to fill a single waterskin without harming them. Doing so again before the leshy can replenish the water causes the leshy to immediately suffer from dehydration。

Spiny Body.name: Spiny Body
Spiny Body.description: A cactus leshy is covered in spines. A creature that @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabs} the cactus leshy takes [[/r {1d8+3}[piercing]]]{1d8+3穿刺伤害}。

Verdant Burst.name: Verdant Burst
Verdant Burst.description: When a cactus leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r {2d8}[healing]]]{2d8生命值} to each plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area sprouts cacti, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for the cacti, they wither after 24 hours。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The cactus leshy transforms into a Small cactus. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{树化术 Tree Shape}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Prickly Burst.name: Prickly Burst
Prickly Burst.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 The cactus leshy shoots their spines in every direction. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] take [[/r {3d6}[piercing]]]{3d6穿刺伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:18|basic:true]豁免)。

Caligni Caller.name: Caligni Caller
Caligni Caller.publicNotes:
Although the mysterious demigods known as the Forsaken disappeared eons ago, many calignis continue to follow their ancient traditions of worship.

Owbs, once the Forsaken's servants, still respond to caligni prayers. Caligni callers serve as the priests of their communities, calling upon these shadowy owb patrons for guidance, favors, and power. Their most important ceremony, the blanching, determines the potential of most newborn calignis and shapes their eventual forms.

Due to their close ties to the malevolent owbs, most callers exhibit cruel and inscrutable natures. They often lead caligni enclaves alongside caligni stalkers as spiritual advisors. Callers tend to be highly superstitious, seeing omens everywhere, and they avoid revealing details of their rituals even to other calignis.

Each individual in caligni society serves a specific role. At times, certain roles so rarely find suitable candidates that a community might only see a few individuals fill them in an entire generation。

Death Umbra.name: Death Umbra
Death Umbra.description:
When the caller dies, an explosion of shadow devours their body. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save.

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

失败 The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1} for 1 minute。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The caller deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Caligni Vanguard.name: Caligni Vanguard
Caligni Vanguard.publicNotes:
Caligni children born without eyes-an extremely rare occurrence-are considered sacred to their communities. From a young age, they're set aside and groomed to become caligni vanguards, dedicated to rigorous martial training and mental strictures. Other calignis revere vanguards' discipline and combat skill, but wary caution always tinges such respect, as they often have inscrutable motives. Vanguards almost never rebel against their duties or their established role in the community; some claim that those who do are taken by the owbs.

A vanguard's armor is fused to their body in pieces, and they rarely remove those elements that aren't. This armor plating and vanguards' keen sense of hearing render them particularly sensitive to sonic vibrations, which serves as both an asset and a vulnerability.

Each individual in caligni society serves a specific role. At times, certain roles so rarely find suitable candidates that a community might only see a few individuals fill them in an entire generation。

f27aQS5iwwcDr82I.name: Full Plate (see Death Blaze)
f27aQS5iwwcDr82I.description: Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets。

Echolocation 60 feet.name: Echolocation 60 feet
Echolocation 60 feet.description: A caligni vanguard can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range。

Death Blaze.name: Death Blaze
Death Blaze.description:
When the vanguard dies, their body combusts in a blaze of fire and armor shrapnel.

All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] take [[/r {3d6}[fire] + {3d6}[piercing]]]{3d6 fire damage and 3d6穿刺伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]豁免).

The vanguard's armor is destroyed in the blaze, but their other gear is unaffected and left in a pile where they died。

Call to Arms.name: Call to Arms
Call to Arms.description: Each caligni within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} of the vanguard gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction until the end of the vanguard's next turn. Once a caligni has used this Attack of Opportunity, that caligni is temporarily immune to the same vanguard's Call to Arms for 10 minutes。

Shadowed Blade.name: Shadowed Blade
Shadowed Blade.description: The vanguard makes a melee Strike, channeling shadowy essence into their weapon or unarmed attack to envelop the target. If the Strike hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the end of its next turn。

Calikang.name: Calikang
Calikang.publicNotes:
Calikangs are giant, blue-skinned, six-armed guardians of ancient tombs and treasuries. They each feel a deep, inherent drive to protect and guard, making them highly sought after as wardens and bodyguards. Because most serve as solitary guardians, few calikang societies exist.

Calikangs' unique physiologies enable them to absorb and manipulate electrical magic as well as other energies. They can live for 200 years-though they can further extend their lives via suspended animation. For this reason, many are chosen to guard tombs or other sealed sites where living guardians would perish and constructs would deteriorate。

Suspended Animation.name: Suspended Animation
Suspended Animation.description:
By concentrating for 5 minutes, the calikang can enter a state of suspended animation, freezing in place and becoming motionless but remaining aware of their surroundings.

While in this state, the calikang gains a +4 status bonus to Fortitude saves; doesn't age; and is immune to disease, inhaled toxins, poison, starvation, and thirst.

The calikang can exit suspended animation as a free action. If they exit this state to attack, the calikang gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their initiative roll。

Energy Conversion.name: Energy Conversion
Energy Conversion.description:
Whenever the calikang is hit by an electricity spell's attack roll or rolls a successful save against a spell that deals electricity damage, they absorb the energy.

This heals the calikang for an amount of HP equal to quadruple the spell's level and recharges their Breath Weapon. A calikang can't absorb their own spells this way。

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
频率 once per day.

效果 The calikang breathes a blast of energy that deals 13d6 energy damage to creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:60] (DC 28 basic Reflex豁免). The calikang can choose the damage type each time: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic.

Increase the die size to d8 if the calikang chooses electricity.

  • [[/r {13d6}[acid]]]{13d6 acid伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|traits:acid|basic:true]豁免)
  • [[/r {13d6}[cold]]]{13d6 cold伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|traits:cold|basic:true]豁免)
  • [[/r {13d8}[electricity]]]{13d8电击伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|traits:electricity|basic:true]豁免)
  • [[/r {13d6}[fire]]]{13d6火焰伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|traits:fire|basic:true]豁免)
  • [[/r {13d6}[sonic]]]{13d6音波伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|traits:sonic|basic:true]豁免)

Sixfold Flurry.name: Sixfold Flurry
Sixfold Flurry.description:
The calikang makes up to two longsword Strikes and up to four fist Strikes. Each Strike must be against a different target.

These attacks count toward the calikang's multiple attack penalty, which doesn't increase until after all the attacks are complete.

For 1 round, the calikang gains a circumstance bonus to their AC equal to the number of Strikes they choose not to take, to a maximum of +4 for taking only two Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.zXIpCkTtFRkhwI4x]{效果: Sixfold Flurry}

Camel.name: Camel
Camel.publicNotes:
For generations untold, nomads and traders have relied on sure-footed camels to cross the harsh deserts and trackless wastes around the world. Thriving where other animals wither and perish, camels are well-adapted to their homes with tough skin and the ability to store nutrients within their bodies. Properly cared for, these "ships of the desert" can trek for weeks between oases without trouble.

Camels have three eyelids to protect them from desert sands and other blowing debris. One lid is completely clear, which allows them to see and travel during high winds. When sandstorms strike, camels completely close their nostrils to protect their lungs. Their underbellies also sport a thick, specialized skin, allowing them to lay down safely on burning hot sands.

Contrary to popular belief, fatty tissue comprises a camel's humps rather than water. This stored energy allows the animals to survive long distances between feedings. These herbivores can also readily digest hardy scrub brush inedible to other species, making them one of the hardiest desert survivors. Strong as a warhorse, camels can run fast and even sprint for short periods of time when they feel threatened, though they prefer a slow, plodding pace to conserve energy.

One-humped camels, also called dromedaries, are more common in the deserts of northern Garund, while the two-humped variety are native to the dry steppes of Casmaron. Both species have tall and lanky builds, standing about 6 feet at the shoulder and weighing around 2,000 pounds. They can be ornery when mishandled, and they don't hesitate to bite, kick, or even spit a noxious substance on riders who don't treat them well.

In addition to transporting people and goods, camels are a key source of fiber for clothing and tents as well as milk. Their meat is highly nutritious and surprisingly tasty, but given the creatures' utility, this use is reserved for special occasions or truly dire situations。

Desert-Adapted.name: Desert-Adapted
Desert-Adapted.description: A camel is well-adapted to heat and deserts. If allowed to drink and eat its fill, (roughly 40 gallons), it can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} for 2 weeks without needing to attempt Survival checks, and it treats environmental heat as if it was one step less severe。

Camel Spit.name: Camel Spit
Camel Spit.description:
To drive away enemies, the camel spits the partially digested contents of its stomach at a creature within 10 feet.

On a hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目眩 Dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}.

The camel can't use its camel spit Strike again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Camel Spit]]{1d4轮}。

Sand Stride.name: Sand Stride
Sand Stride.description: The camel Strides twice. It has a +5-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides, ignoring difficult terrain caused by rubble, sand, and uneven ground made of earth and stone。

Caulborn.name: Caulborn
Caulborn.publicNotes:
Telepathic prophets and historians, caulborn gather in small cabals for protection and camaraderie, using their collective brainpower to unravel cosmic conundrums. Once they've exhausted an area's secrets, they depart, seeking new homes hidden within cities, sequestering themselves within caves, or lurking in forgotten corners of the planes. From the moment an ioton absorbs especially profound thoughts and begins taking on the permanent form of a young caulborn, these ennosites' genius and toughness grow with each new discovery. Absorbing such information destabilizes their corporeal form, like when books are stacked too high, so excess knowledge seeps from a caulborn's body, causing a literal brain drain that caulborn find incredibly vexing. To avoid this occurrence, caulborn must feed on others' psychic energy to maintain themselves, which is usually a harmless process. Especially hungry caulborn even abduct prey.

Despite their need to feed, caulborn rarely care to interact with other creatures, especially beings that could react to their appearance with fear or hostility. They occasionally make exceptions for accomplished scholars or storied travelers, however, bartering their own lore for outside secrets.

星界是主位面的交汇点，将内环位面（Inner Sphere）和外环位面（Outer Sphere）连接起来，这是一个拥有无尽的银色物质的领域，斥着来自整个浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的精神本质。星界里的大多数生物都是过客——试图从灵魂之河（River of Souls）偷猎的捕食者，防范此类入侵的招魂者，以及监控位面之间原始精华流向的御衡者。然而，这个位面本身产生了一些以奇怪电流和旋涡维生的生物，其中最重要的是由思想产生的生物族类，被称为思诞族。

思诞族在物理形态体现了它所代表的思想和目的。一些思诞族拥有相同的理想和目标，因此他们的形态也较为接近。

Collective Sense.name: Collective Sense
Collective Sense.description: Caulborn are aware of all other caulborn within @Template[type:emanation|distance:300]{300尺}, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HTou8cG05yuSkesj]{Status} spell, and they can perceive anything within the other caulborns' thoughtsense. If two or more caulborn are within range of each others' thoughtsense, they can't be flanked。

Consume Thoughts.name: Consume Thoughts
Consume Thoughts.description:
需求 The caulborn's last action was a successful hand Strike

效果 The caulborn steals some of the psychic energy from the creature it hit. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save; regardless of the outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to Consume Thoughts for 1 minute.

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute, and the caulborn regains [[/r {1d12}[healing]]]{1d12生命值}.

大失败 As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 1 minute and the caulborn regains [[/r {2d12}[healing]]]{2d12生命值}. If the target was already stupefied when the caulborn used this ability, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} for 1 round。

Cooperative Scrying.name: Cooperative Scrying
Cooperative Scrying.description:
Three or more caulborn adjacent to each other can collectively cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying} once per day (@Check[type:will|dc:25]), with no limit to the duration so long as at least three caulborn remain adjacent and use no actions other than to Sustain the Spell.

The daily limit applies to all caulborn who participated, meaning none of them can participate in another scrying that day。

Cave Giant.name: Cave Giant
Cave Giant.publicNotes:
Cave giants are the vicious loners of the giant world. Even their closest ancestral kin, the rampaging hill giants, mostly find cave giants too brutal and antisocial to form alliances with. For their part, cave giants-garbed in stinking hides festooned with the rotting skulls of their victims-seem ambivalent about their foul reputation. They are more interested in hunting and killing their next meal than forming alliances.

For all their disregard of others' opinions, cave giants are cautious when it comes to defending territory. Cave giant traps are simple yet effective, such as rounded boulders that can be pushed down steep tunnels, camouflaged pits filled with sharpened stakes, and even compromised stalactites that can suddenly fall on unsuspecting intruders.

In coastal towns and hillside villages with caves a common feature of the landscape, cave giants star as common villains in local tall tales. Many youngsters and aspiring heroes dare one another to venture into remote grottoes or abandoned mine shafts in the hopes of discovering a cave giant, and all too often their searches prove successful. Grieving villagers pay skilled adventures handsomely to locate the whereabouts of their missing kin. The bounty for such hunts might be as much as an entire village harvest's worth of gold, particularly if a local cave giant has been a frequent enough menace or the missing villager is particularly beloved.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands。

Smear.name: Smear
Smear.description:
需求 The cave giant is within reach of a creature that is adjacent to a wall or other solid vertical surface

效果 The cave giant snags the creature and smashes it against the wall. The giant attempts an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC. On a success, the cave giant @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{攫抓 Grabs} the creature and smears it along the nearby wall, dealing [[/r {2d8+8}[bludgeoning]]]{2d8+8钝击伤害}. On a critical success, the damage is doubled。

Cecaelia Trapper.name: Cecaelia Trapper
Cecaelia Trapper.publicNotes:
Cecaelias resemble humans with octopus tentacles instead of legs. These oceanic hunters are agile and intelligent creatures, but proud. Their inquisitiveness often brings them into contact with strangers, where a poor turn of phrase or an unintended insult can quickly spark their legendary tempers.

Cecaelias live nomadic lives, hunting and scavenging along coastlines for food and tradeable trinkets. They engage in frequent trade with terrestrial communities, offering anything from seafood to treasures retrieved from sunken vessels in exchange for goods not readily available underwater. Some take to piracy or hire themselves out as mercenaries, but their quarrelsome disposition invariably leads to them going their own way again before too long. The only non-cecaelia communities that maintain long-lasting relationships with cecaelias are those of the remarkably laid-back locathahs, who coexist with cecaelias in the city of Xidao.

Cecaelias live in warm waters along verdant ocean reefs or coastlines, often near humanoid settlements. Able to adapt rapidly over a few generations, cecaelias adopt the physical features of their closest humanoid neighbors, which sages liken to an octopus's natural camouflage。

Cecaelia Jet.name: Cecaelia Jet
Cecaelia Jet.description: The cecaelia moves up to 140 feet in a straight line through the water。

Hurl Net.name: Hurl Net
Hurl Net.description:
需求 The cecaelia is holding a net in two appendages.

效果 The cecaelia hurls their net, attempting to hamper a foe. The cecaelia makes a ranged Strike (with a [[/r 1d20+15 #Hurl Net]]{+15} modifier) against a Medium or smaller creature within 20 feet.

On a hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} the net is 16. A creature adjacent to the target can Interact with the net to remove it from the target.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.q2D1QBalqBQfKzTc]{效果: Hurl Net}

Ink Cloud.name: Ink Cloud
Ink Cloud.description:
The cecaelia emits a cloud of black ink in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]. This ink cloud has no effect outside of water. Creatures inside the cloud are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by creatures using sight or smell, and they can't see or smell while inside the cloud. The cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

The cecaelia can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6轮}。

Chouchin-Obake.name: Chouchin-Obake
Chouchin-Obake.publicNotes:
A chouchin-obake takes the shape of a paper lantern with a horizontal split near the bottom from which a long tongue protrudes. Upon closer inspection, two eyes appear above the split mouth. Chouchin-obake are anomalous in that they don't awaken in the same way other tsukumogami do. Paper lanterns are nearly impossible to maintain for long enough to spawn tsukumogami. Instead, a chouchin-obake is a kind of fire kami that takes the form of a lantern's flame and inhabits a paper lantern when they manifest.

Tsukumogami are intelligent, mobile objects formed from the union between a 100-year-old object and a kami. Tsukumogami range from harmless to malicious, each individual personality a result of how the object was treated before its awakening. Well-cared-for objects tend to birth helpful, friendly tsukumogami, while mistreated or abandoned objects twist into malevolent and violent beings.Most tsukumogami are, by nature, mischievous, and oftentimes want nothing more than to occupy the attention of living creatures.

Tsukumogami can commonly be found in areas with a strong cultural belief iin the value of caring for objects, which helps items survive long enough to become tsukumogami. Towns and villages with large tsukumogami populations are referred to as "sleepless towns" due to the nightly tsukumogami celebrations, which can become so raucous that they prevent the living residents from sleeping peacefully。

Lifewick Candle.name: Lifewick Candle
Lifewick Candle.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A ghostly blue flame within the chouchin-obake draws upon the life-force of the living to sustain themself.

At the start of the chouchin-obake's turn, each creature in the aura takes [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6负能量伤害} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true]豁免). The chouchin-obake regains an amount of Hit Points equal to the amount of damage taken by the single creature that took the most damage。

Shadowbind.name: Shadowbind
Shadowbind.description:
触发 A creature attempts to leave the chouchin-obake's Lifewick Candle aura during a move action

效果 The chouchin-obake attempts to bind the creature using their own shadow. The triggering creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized} until its next turn。

Chyzaedu.name: Chyzaedu
Chyzaedu.publicNotes: Chyzaedus' home world was consumed millennia ago by the Dominion of the Black via the manipulation of a black hole. Rather than accept destruction or fight back, the chyzaedus instead joined forces with their destroyers, seeing in them a greater purpose than mere world domination. Today, chyzaedus serve in a role akin to a priesthood for the Dominion and take a sinister interest in bringing their beliefs to new worlds, teaching ignorant dwellers the glory of pure entropic destruction. Much like the black holes they venerate, chyzaedus possess an eternal hunger for sustenance and knowledge alike-they can never be sated by either, yet they will never starve as long as there are mortals whose energy they can feed upon。

Alien Vestment.name: Alien Vestment
Alien Vestment.description:
The chyzaedu wears an eerie, alien layer of shimmering violet mucus that slithers and crawls over its flesh, but is hard as iron to the touch.

If a chyzaedu takes bludgeoning damage from a critical hit, its alien vestment is shattered—this reduces its AC to 27 and causes it to lose its resistance to mental and physical damage; it can grow a new alien vestment by concentrating for 1 hour。

Ecstatic Hunger.name: Ecstatic Hunger
Ecstatic Hunger.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A chyzaedu gains sustenance by feeding upon the metabolisms of organic victims. A living creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save.

大成功 The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

成功 The creature suffers a painful hunger pang, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} for 1 round.

失败 If possible, the creature spends its first 2 actions on its next turn eating or drinking (or spending actions to procure food or drink from its possessions or the surroundings, if necessary). The creature won't consume anything dangerous, but will eat things it normally has no appetite for.

大失败 As failure, but the creature will eat or drink dangerous consumables, such as poison or rotten food, if other food or drink are not immediately available. The creature must spend its first 2 actions each round consuming for as long as it remains in the chyzaedu's aura plus 1 minute thereafter, but the creature can attempt a new saving throw at the end of its turn each round to end the effect early.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

City Guard Squadron.name: City Guard Squadron
City Guard Squadron.publicNotes:
Most towns and cities on Golarion have a garrison of professional guards whose duties include patrolling the streets, assisting citizenry in need, and acting as a quick military response in times of crisis. Guards usually operate in pairs or small groups, but when a serious emergency threatens, guards muster at the nearest keep, watch station, or other rallying point and then move out in search of their quarry.Alternatively, guard troops might be stationed at important locations in the city, such as the front gates, the main prison, or the entrance to the ruler's castle.

Individual guards may not be particularly well trained or experienced, but in large numbers they can defeat bandits, wild creatures that have slipped past the city gates, or the occasional drunken ogre. A group of city guards is usually accompanied and commanded by a single captain, who does most of the talking and gives individual guards their orders. The members of this city guard squadron have trained together to perform simple tactics but not advanced maneuvers。

Seek Quarry.name: Seek Quarry
Seek Quarry.description: City guards can spend 1 minute to designate a single creature for whom they have a physical description as their quarry. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception against their quarry。

Fire Crossbows!.name: Fire Crossbows!
Fire Crossbows!.description:
The city guards draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley.

This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet that deals [[/r {3d8}[piercing]]]{3d8穿刺伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]豁免). When the city guards are reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]。

Lower Halberds!.name: Lower Halberds!
Lower Halberds!.description:
1 to 3

频率 once per round.

效果 The city guards engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy within @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10尺}, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 [[/r {1d10}[piercing]]]{1d10穿刺伤害} or [[/r {1d10}[slashing]]]{1d10挥砍伤害}

2 [[/r {1d10+7}[piercing]]]{1d10+7穿刺伤害} or [[/r {1d10+7}[slashing]]]{1d10+7挥砍伤害}

3 [[/r {1d10+10}[piercing]]]{1d10+10穿刺伤害} or [[/r {1d10+10}[slashing]]]{1d10+10挥砍伤害}

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description:
Whenever the city guards Stride, they first @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.OvqohW9YuahnFaiX]{Form Up} as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed.

This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the guards enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to all the guards。

Urban Chasers.name: Urban Chasers
Urban Chasers.description: City guards ignore difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways。

Clacking Sea Skull Swarm.name: Clacking Sea Skull Swarm
Clacking Sea Skull Swarm.publicNotes:
Roiling about in seething waves of bleached death, clacking skull swarms arise from the remains of dozens of beheaded humanoids. The horrible clattering of the skulls' onslaught drives their prey to distraction even while they try to flee in terror.

A skull swarm is composed of reanimated masses of craniums and jawbones, forming a terrifying avalanche of undead fury. Most skull swarms are mindless, though some retain a vestige of wit, awareness, and even magical talents from life, culminating in a highly intelligent swarm mind。

Boneshard Burst.name: Boneshard Burst
Boneshard Burst.description: When a clacking skull swarm is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it erupts in an explosion of foul energy and bone fragments in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30], dealing [[/r {2d12}[piercing]+{2d12}[negative]]]{2d12 piercing damage and 2d12负能量伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true]豁免)。

Chattering Teeth.name: Chattering Teeth
Chattering Teeth.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A clacking skull swarm emits a cacophony of chattering. A creature entering or beginning its turn within the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} for 1 round. A creature that successfully saves is immune to that swarm's chattering teeth for 24 hours. The swarm can stop or resume this ability as a free action。

Shrieking Scream.name: Shrieking Scream
Shrieking Scream.description:
The clacking skull swarm emits a terrifying, painful scream that deals [[/r {10d6}[sonic]]]{10d6音波伤害} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:29|basic:true]豁免). A creature that fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

The swarm can't use Frightening Scream again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Scream]]{1d4轮}。

Swarming Gnaw.name: Swarming Gnaw
Swarming Gnaw.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {4d8}[piercing]]]{4d8穿刺伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true]豁免)。

Clacking Skull Swarm.name: Clacking Skull Swarm
Clacking Skull Swarm.publicNotes:
Roiling about in seething waves of bleached death, clacking skull swarms arise from the remains of dozens of beheaded humanoids. The horrible clattering of the skulls' onslaught drives their prey to distraction even while they try to flee in terror.

A skull swarm is composed of reanimated masses of craniums and jawbones, forming a terrifying avalanche of undead fury. Most skull swarms are mindless, though some retain a vestige of wit, awareness, and even magical talents from life, culminating in a highly intelligent swarm mind。

Boneshard Burst.name: Boneshard Burst
Boneshard Burst.description: When a clacking skull swarm is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it erupts in an explosion of foul energy and bone fragments in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30], dealing [[/r {2d12}[piercing]+{2d12}[negative]]]{2d12 piercing damage and 2d12负能量伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true]豁免)。

Chattering Teeth.name: Chattering Teeth
Chattering Teeth.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

A clacking skull swarm emits a cacophony of chattering. A creature entering or beginning its turn within the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} for 1 round. A creature that successfully saves is immune to that swarm's chattering teeth for 24 hours. The swarm can stop or resume this ability as a free action。

Shrieking Scream.name: Shrieking Scream
Shrieking Scream.description:
The clacking skull swarm emits a terrifying, painful scream that deals [[/r {10d6}[sonic]]]{10d6音波伤害} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:will|dc:29|basic:true]豁免). A creature that fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

The swarm can't use Frightening Scream again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Scream]]{1d4轮}。

Swarming Gnaw.name: Swarming Gnaw
Swarming Gnaw.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {4d8}[piercing]]]{4d8穿刺伤害} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true]豁免)。

Clockwork Dragon.name: Clockwork Dragon
Clockwork Dragon.publicNotes:
Clockwork dragons are a marvel of clockwork design. These powerful masterpieces have the ability to fly, making them versatile and dangerous killers. A clockwork dragon's winding mechanism is more efficient than those of other clockworks, allowing it to partially reuse energy generated by flapping its wings. Creating a clockwork dragon requires not only an advanced understanding of clockwork design, but also a greater cache of rare resources, as its body requires solid reinforcement. As a result, most clockwork dragons have adamantine fortification. Creating a clockwork dragon without adamantine is entirely possible, though such dragons are typically smaller and more fragile.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner。

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
1 week, @Check[type:thievery|traits:action:disable-device|dc:35], standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode。

Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
Self-Destruct.description:
A clockwork dragon must use this reaction unless specifically programmed otherwise by its creator.

触发 The clockwork dragon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

效果 The dragon screeches to a stop and emits a steady, loud ticking sound. At the beginning of what would have been its next turn, the dragon explodes, dealing [[/r {12d10}[piercing]]]{12d10穿刺伤害} in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true]豁免).

An adjacent creature can cancel the self-destruct sequence by succeeding at a @Check[type:thievery|dc:37|traits:action:disable-device] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}。

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
The clockwork dragon breathes a spray of flaming oil that deals [[/r {16d6}[fire]]]{16d6火焰伤害} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true]豁免).

Creatures that fail their saves are covered in burning oil and take @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Fire2d6.success].

The clockwork dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for 2 rounds。

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The clockwork dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order。

Spearing Tail.name: Spearing Tail
Spearing Tail.description:
The clockwork dragon attacks with the sharp point of its tail.

It makes a tail Strike against each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:20], rolling the attack roll once and applying the result to each target. Any creature hit takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.success] (@Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.criticalSuccess] on a critical hit). This counts as two attacks for the dragon's multiple attack penalty。

Clockwork Mage.name: Clockwork Mage
Clockwork Mage.publicNotes:
A clockwork mage is a lethal blend of magic and machinery. Each of these clockworks is imbued with an arcane stone at its core that powers spells through the wand embedded in its chest.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner。

Clockwork Wand.name: Clockwork Wand
Clockwork Wand.description:
The clockwork wand is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.vJZ49cgi8szuQXAD]{Magic Wand} containing the last 2nd-level innate spell the clockwork mage cast (the GM determines the spell randomly if it has not cast any eligible spells). The spells are placed within the wand while the mage is created, and the creator can substitute other arcane spells of the appropriate level.

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

频率 once per day, plus overcharge

效果 You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, @Check[type:thievery|traits:action:disable-device|dc:26], standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode。

Clockwork Wand.name: Clockwork Wand
Clockwork Wand.description:
The clockwork mage uses a mechanical wand as a focus to channel magical energy. This wand is built into the clockwork mage's chest, with only the crystal at the end exposed. The mage can Interact to the remove the wand, or someone else can remove it with a @Check[type:thievery|dc:31|traits:action:disable-device] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}. The clockwork mage becomes unable to cast any spells except cantrips while the wand is removed.

When removed, the clockwork wand is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.vJZ49cgi8szuQXAD]{Magic Wand} containing the last 2nd-level innate spell the clockwork mage cast (the GM determines the spell randomly if it has not cast any eligible spells). The spells are placed within the wand while the mage is created, and the creator can substitute other arcane spells of the appropriate level。

Energize Clockwork Wand.name: Energize Clockwork Wand
Energize Clockwork Wand.description:
频率 once per 10 minutes.

效果 The clockwork mage regains a spell it has already cast that day. It must spend 1 hour of its operational time, or 2 hours if the spell is 3rd level or higher。

Clockwork Soldier.name: Clockwork Soldier
Clockwork Soldier.publicNotes:
These diligent machines guard their assigned posts tirelessly. A typical clockwork soldier stands 6 feet tall and consists of 500 pounds of metal and magic.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner。
